title: Open technologies, public procurement and economic impact: lessons from Denmark for Europe’s next digital laws
content: Europe’s debate on cloud, artificial intelligence and digital sovereignty often assumes a trade-off between competitiveness, control, and cost. Evidence from public-sector procurement suggests the opposite. When governments use their purchasing power to create sustained demand for open source technologies, supported by appropriate institutional capacity, they can strengthen domestic digital ecosys
creator: Astor Nummelin Carlberg
sourceDescription: Open Technologies for Europe's Digital Decade

title: 2025 in Review: Twenty-Three Years of Open Technology Dialogue and Policy Engagement
content: Dear friends and partners, As I look back on 2025, my final year as Executive Director of OpenForum Europe, I want to extend my sincere thanks to all who have shaped this organisation. I am grateful to the OFE staff, past and present, for their commitment to our mission, and to the OFE Board for … Czytaj dalej

title: OFE, OSI & OKF Form Partnership to Advance Open Technology Research
content: Rio de Janeiro, November 2025 – OpenForum Europe (OFE), the Open Source Initiative (OSI), and the Open Knowledge Foundation (OKFN) today announced a strategic partnership — the Open Technology Research Network (OTRN) — to strengthen the global open technology research community and advance evidence-based policymaking around open technologies. Open technologies — including software, data, and stand
creator: Nicholas Gates
sourceDescription: Open Technologies for Europe's Digital Decade

title: OFE’s Public Letter Calls on the EU to Invest in Sovereign Tech Fund
content: Today, a new coalition of industry leaders, open source companies, and civil society has come together with OpenForum Europe to urge the EU to invest a minimum of €350 million to maintain critical open source software underpinning Europe’s digital infrastructure. Initiated by OpenForum Europe, dozens of organisations have signed a Public Letter calling specifically for … Czytaj dalej
creator: Nicholas Gates
sourceDescription: Open Technologies for Europe's Digital Decade

title: OFE Landmark Study Urges EU to Invest in Open Digital Infrastructure
content: OpenForum Europe (OFE) has released its much-anticipated report, Funding Europe’s Open Digital Infrastructure: A Study on the Economic, Legal, and Political Feasibility of an EU Sovereign Tech Fund (EU-STF). Developed in collaboration with Fraunhofer ISI and the European University Institute, the study makes a forceful case for a mission-driven, EU-wide investment vehicle to address systemic … Czy
creator: Nicholas Gates
sourceDescription: Open Technologies for Europe's Digital Decade

title: Cambridge Forum Supports OFA Symposium 2025 with Themed Issue
content: The Call for Proposals deadline for the OpenForum Academy Symposium 2025 has been extended to 23:59 CET on June 18, 2025. Submit your work here. The Cambridge Forum on Technology and Global Affairs, an open access journal from Cambridge University Press, has announced the launch of a themed issue titled “Open Technology Impact in … Czytaj dalej

title: OFE’s Proposal for an EU Sovereign Tech Fund
content: With the new European Commission and Parliament in place – as well as a dramatically different international outlook – the EU is increasingly focused on building independent digital alternatives, often framed through the lens of ‘digital sovereignty’. This has, for example, been made clear in the independent EuroStack Initiative, the efforts to create a report … Czytaj dalej

title: New content partners for the OFA Symposium 2025
content: The OpenForum Academy (OFA) is pleased to announce its roster of Content Partners for the upcoming OFA Symposium 2025. This year’s Symposium will benefit from the perspectives and expertise of three leading organisations in this space as Content Partners: the Open Knowledge Foundation, the Open Source Initiative, and the Digital Public Goods Alliance.   Set … Czytaj dalej

title: OFE endorses the UN Open Source Principles
content: OpenForum Europe (OFE) is excited to announce that we have joined 15 other leading open source organisations – and many more soon to come – in endorsing the United Nations (UN) Open Source Principles. This follows the initial endorsement by the Open Source Initiative (OSI), and is in accordance with a recent UN announcement. The … Czytaj dalej

sourceDescription: Open Technologies for Europe's Digital Decade

title: “How can you cover a topic that is so huge?” Basil Cousins Award elevates young open source scholars
content: “The OFA Symposium is a valuable platform for recognising and raising the research profile of early career scholars, as they contribute to enriching interdisciplinary discussions on the future of FOSS.
